subject: Re: Native Code and JUnit
msgSnippet: I received help from Rama for the same problem some time ago: see below. With noloading you have to restart JUnit each time after modifying code. /Marc From:
messageBody:
I received help from Rama for the same problem some time ago: see
below. With "noloading" you have to restart JUnit each time after
modifying code.
/Marc

From: G Ramasubramani <grama@a...>
Date: Mon Jan 29, 2001 2:09 pm
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Native Library already loaded in another
classloader


This seems to be the same old issue with ClassLoaders. Try this.
In the directory indicated by the user.home property, create a file
called junit.properties which has the following

loading=false

This should solve your problem.

Rama

--- In junit@y..., "Markus Kohler" <kohler@c...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I'm trying to test some Java code that uses JNI to access some
native
> Windows NT functions.
> I'm running into trouble when loading the library.
> When running the test using the swing GUI it works only every
second time.
> The problem is that it claims that the library (dll) is already
loaded.
>
> For loading the dll I added the line
> System.loadLibrary("myLib");
>
> to setup()
>
> Does anybody know how to detect that the library is loaded ?
>
> Regards,
> Markus
>
>
